intro: Erodium cicutarium var. allotrichum, commonly known as common bedstraw, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine, hairy texture. The plant produces small, pink or red flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks.
